Package io.github.ai4ci.util

Class ProbabilityScaler

java.lang.Object
io.github.ai4ci.util.ProbabilityScaler
public class ProbabilityScaler extends Object
Utility class for scaling probabilities using power transformations. Provides methods to find the appropriate scaling factor k such that the scaled probabilities sum to a desired target, as well as direct scaling of probabilities using a given k. The main method findScalingFactor uses Newton-Raphson iteration with a bisection fallback to robustly solve for the scaling factor. Example usage: 
 double[] probs = { 0.1, 0.5, 0.4 };
 double targetSum = 2.0;
 double k = ProbabilityScaler.findScalingFactor(probs, targetSum);
 double[] scaledProbs = ProbabilityScaler.scaleProbabilities(probs, k);
Author:
Rob Challen

  • Method Details

    • findScalingFactor

      public static double findScalingFactor(double[] probabilities, double targetSum)
      Convenience method with default tolerance and iterations.
      Parameters:
      probabilities - Array of probabilities in [0, 1]
      targetSum - Desired sum of scaled probabilities (must be in feasible range)
      Returns:
      Scaling factor k > 0 such that sum(p_i^(1/k)) ≈ targetSum
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if inputs are invalid or targetSum is infeasible
      See Also:
      • findScalingFactor(double[], double, double, int)

    • findScalingFactor

      public static double findScalingFactor(double[] probabilities, double targetSum, double tolerance, int maxIterations)
      Scales probabilities using power transformation: q_i = p_i^(1/k) Finds k such that sum(q_i) = targetSum using Newton-Raphson with bisection fallback.
      Parameters:
      probabilities - Array of probabilities in [0, 1]
      targetSum - Desired sum of scaled probabilities (must be in feasible range)
      tolerance - Convergence tolerance (default 1e-8)
      maxIterations - Maximum iterations for solver (default 50)
      Returns:
      Scaling factor k > 0 such that sum(p_i^(1/k)) ≈ targetSum
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if inputs are invalid or targetSum is infeasible

    • scaleProbabilities

      public static double[] scaleProbabilities(double[] probabilities, double k)
      Applies power scaling to probabilities using given k: q_i = p_i^(1/k)
      Parameters:
      probabilities - Array of probabilities in [0, 1]
      k - Scaling factor (must be positive)
      Returns:
      Scaled probabilities array where q_i = p_i^(1/k)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if k is not positive

    • scaleProbability

      public static double scaleProbability(double probabilities, double k)
      Scales a single probability using power transformation: q = p^(1/k)
      Parameters:
      probabilities - Probability in [0, 1]
      k - Scaling factor (must be positive)
      Returns:
      Scaled probability q = p^(1/k)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if k is not positive

    • scaleToTargetSum

      public static double[] scaleToTargetSum(double[] probabilities, double targetSum)
      Direct method: scales probabilities to achieve target sum in one call. Internally finds the appropriate scaling factor k and applies it.
      Parameters:
      probabilities - Array of probabilities in [0, 1]
      targetSum - Desired sum of scaled probabilities (must be in feasible range)
      Returns:
      Scaled probabilities array where sum(q_i) ≈ targetSum
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if inputs are invalid or targetSum is infeasible
